snippet: Martin Kaymer, who opened the tournament with a course-record 65, closed with a 69 at Pinehurst No. 2 for a 72-hole total of nine-under-par 271. He finished eight strokes ahead of Erik Compton and Rickie Fowler.
abstract: Martin Kaymer wins the United States Open golf tournament at Pinehurst Resort in North Carolina; his final-round 69 gives him a tournament total of 271, nine under par; Erik Compton and Rickie Fowler, only other players to finish under par, tie for second place at 279; Kaymer, who led all the way, is Open's first German winner.
lead_paragraph: Martin Kaymer, who opened the tournament with a course-record 65, closed with a 69 at Pinehurst No. 2 for a 72-hole total of nine-under-par 271. He finished eight strokes ahead of Erik Compton and Rickie Fowler.

headline.main: Kaymer, Leading All the Way, Wins by 8 for His First U.S. Open Title
headline.print_headline: Kaymer, Leading All the Way, Leaves No Doubt
